comment.author: 15960077@N03
comment._content: I got married here last year, that same road still exists and if my geography serves me well the large building to the left of the picture in the distance is the original of the hotel we had our reception in, the only part of which remains is a ruin near the new hotel which was built by the Burke family who ran the original. And, as a matter of interest, in the days before our wedding there was a party for a member of that family who was 100 years old, so there's a good chance she was alive when this was taken!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/15960077@N03] What a lovely place to get married!!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 15960077@N03
comment._content: Would you believe it rained non stop for the the two days before the wedding and on the day we got the best day of last summer, it was stunning. There's a picture from the day here.... www.flickr.com/photos/15960077@N03/6074650167/in/photostream
